intro: Racosperma subtilinerve, commonly known as the slender-veined acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its bipinnate leaves with fine, delicate veins. The plant produces yellow or pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, globular clusters. Its seed pods are elongated and contain several seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. Racosperma subtilinerve is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient component of native vegetation.
